articles.author: Henriette Chacar, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's troops were battling on Monday to clear out Hamas gunmen more than two days after they burst across the fence from Gaza on a deadly rampage, and the army said it would soon go on the offensive after the biggest mobilisation in Israeli history.
articles.title: Clashes rage in Israel as Hamas fighters hold out 'longer than expected'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian group Hamas's surprise assault on Israel Saturday and Israel's retaliation have killed more than 1,100 people and focused attention on the Iran-backed Islamist group.
articles.title: Iran prisoner swap for $6 billion in spotlight after Hamas attacks Israel

articles.author: Steven Scheer, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: The Bank of Israel said on Monday it will sell up to $30 billion of foreign currency in the open market, in the central bank's first ever sale of foreign exchange, to maintain stability during Israel's war with Palestinian militants in Gaza.
articles.title: Bank of Israel to sell $30 bln of forex to stabilise shekel amid Gaza war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel has drafted a record 300,000 reservists in its response to a multi-front Hamas attack from Gaza and is "going on the offensive," the chief military spokesperson said on Monday.
articles.title: Israel drafts 300,000 reservists as it goes on the offensive

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian Islamist group Hamas deployed a force of about 1,000 fighters to stage the most devastating attack on Israel in decades, organising them into specialised units, a source close to the group told Reuters.
articles.title: Hamas deployed specialised units to attack Israel, says source

articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The United States will send multiple military ships and aircraft closer to Israel as a show of support, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said, with Washington believing Hamas' deadly attacks may have been motivated to disrupt a potential normalizing of Israel-Saudi Arabia ties.
articles.title: US to send military ships, aircraft closer to Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of cars abandoned in the scramble to flee a massacre at an Israeli music festival where Hamas gunmen killed 260 people and took captives back into Gaza underline the scale of the deadliest attack on Israel in decades.
articles.title: Abandoned cars underline panic at Israeli music festival where Hamas gunmen killed hundreds

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Jonathan Saul
articles.description: A careful campaign of deception ensured Israel was caught off guard when the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas launched its devastating attack, enabling a force using bulldozers, hang gliders and motorbikes to take on the Middle East's most powerful army.
articles.title: How Israel was duped as Hamas planned devastating assault

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The violence in Israel will likely prompt a move into safe-haven assets as investors closely watch events in the Middle East to gauge geopolitical risk to markets.
articles.title: Attack on Israel likely to boost appeal of gold, safe-haven assets

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: American economic historian Claudia Goldin won the 2023 Nobel economics prize for "having advanced our understanding of women's labour market outcomes", the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences said on Monday.
articles.title: Nobel economics prize goes to Claudia Goldin
